trans-unit.source: Common cache patterns with Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: Common cache patterns with Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: Learn where and why to use Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: Learn where and why to use Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: This page lists the most common benefits to using a cache.
trans-unit.target: This page lists the most common benefits to using a cache.

trans-unit.source: Using a cache can dramatically speed up data access over fetching from a data store.
trans-unit.target: Using a cache can dramatically speed up data access over fetching from a data store.

trans-unit.source: A cache provides high throughput and low-latency.
trans-unit.target: A cache provides high throughput and low-latency.

trans-unit.source: By fetching hot data from the cache, you not only speed up your app but you can reduce the data access load and increase its responsiveness for other queries.
trans-unit.target: By fetching hot data from the cache, you not only speed up your app but you can reduce the data access load and increase its responsiveness for other queries.

trans-unit.source: Storing information in a cache helps save resources and increases scalability as the demands on the application increase.
trans-unit.target: Storing information in a cache helps save resources and increases scalability as the demands on the application increase.

trans-unit.source: Your app will be much more responsive to bursty loads when it can efficiently fetch data from a cache.
trans-unit.target: Your app will be much more responsive to bursty loads when it can efficiently fetch data from a cache.

trans-unit.source: While it’s considered a best practice is to avoid using session state, some applications can actually have a performance/reduced-complexity benefit from using session data, while other apps outright require session state.
trans-unit.target: While it’s considered a best practice is to avoid using session state, some applications can actually have a performance/reduced-complexity benefit from using session data, while other apps outright require session state.

trans-unit.source: The default in memory provider for session state does not allow scale out (running multiple instances of the web site).
trans-unit.target: The default in memory provider for session state does not allow scale out (running multiple instances of the web site).

trans-unit.source: The ASP.NET SQL Server session state provider will allow multiple web sites to use session state, but it incurs a high latency cost compared to an in memory provider.
trans-unit.target: The ASP.NET SQL Server session state provider will allow multiple web sites to use session state, but it incurs a high latency cost compared to an in memory provider.

trans-unit.source: The Redis session state cache provider is a low latency alternative that is very easy to configure and set up.
trans-unit.target: The Redis session state cache provider is a low latency alternative that is very easy to configure and set up.

trans-unit.source: If your app uses only a limited amount of session state, you can use most of the cache for caching data and a small amount for session state.
trans-unit.target: If your app uses only a limited amount of session state, you can use most of the cache for caching data and a small amount for session state.

trans-unit.source: By storing data in a cache, the application may be able to survive system failures such as network latency, Web service problems, and hardware failures.
trans-unit.target: By storing data in a cache, the application may be able to survive system failures such as network latency, Web service problems, and hardware failures.

trans-unit.source: It's often better to serve cached data until your web service or database recovers, than for your app to completely fail.
trans-unit.target: It's often better to serve cached data until your web service or database recovers, than for your app to completely fail.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about using the Azure Redis Cache:
trans-unit.target: To learn more about using the Azure Redis Cache:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Redis Azure Cache docs </linkText><title></title>: This page provides many good links to using the Redis Azure cache.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Redis Azure Cache docs </linkText><title></title>: This page provides many good links to using the Redis Azure cache.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>MVC movie app with Azure Redis Cache in 15 minutes</linkText><title></title>: The blog post provides a quick start to using the Azure Redis cache in an ASP.NET MVC app.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>MVC movie app with Azure Redis Cache in 15 minutes</linkText><title></title>: The blog post provides a quick start to using the Azure Redis cache in an ASP.NET MVC app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>How to Use ASP.NET Session State with Azure Websites</linkText><title></title>: This topic explains how to use the Azure Redis Cache Service for session state.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>How to Use ASP.NET Session State with Azure Websites</linkText><title></title>: This topic explains how to use the Azure Redis Cache Service for session state.
